text: goals well not that type of goal we're
talking about aspirations hopes and
dreams thoughts about where we want to
be what we want to do and who we are
they could be as big and wild as your
imagination lets you or they can be
small but Mighty we've all had them but
the sad reality is a whopping 92% of
people who set a goal never achieve it
that's a success rate of only 8% but
don't let that put you off if you've
ever struggled to set Define or reach a
goal this video is for you this video is
designed to convert the dreamer into a
goal achiever keep watching as we
explore the Art and Science of goal
setting you'll learn to Define goals
take action track your progress and most
importantly achieve them let's get to it
part one the power of goal setting
imagine hopping aboard a boat ready to
take a trip on the ocean only to find
that the ship doesn't have a destination
it wanders a lessly wasting time and
resources with zero Direction that's you
without a goal goals are your compass
your road map to the life you want
research from Lock and laam Pioneers and
goal setting Theory shows that specific
and challenging goals lead to a higher
rate of performance and therefore
success but why because goals focus our
attention and energy motivating us to
persist take Michael Jordan before
becoming a baset basetball Legend he was
famously cut from his high school
basketball team instead of giving up
Jordan set a goal to outwork everyone
else he spent hours practicing and
refining his skills eventually becoming
one of the greatest athletes of all time
his story proves that clear and
actionable goals are transformative and
with persistence you can achieve any you
set your mind to even if other people
don't think you can part two what are
your goals one of the first things you
need to do to be successful is to Define
your goals you need to get specific
about what you want and break down your
goal into steps for example you might
have a goal to get your dream job but
without defining the steps in place to
get there you'll fail before you've even
begun achieving your goal takes hard
work and you need to know what work to
put in before you start here's the key
to defining your goals the smart method
let's break it down s is for specific I
want to lose weight is too vague instead
I want to lose 10 lb in 3 months by
eating cleaner and exercising four times
a week is specific M is for measurable
numbers matter they let you track
progress and celebrate Milestones
measuring your progress will help
motivate you a is for achievable
challenge yourself but keep it realistic
when a goal is too big it starts to feel
unattainable which can be discouraging
don't don't aim to run a marathon next
month if you've never jogged before R is
for Relevant your goal should align with
your values and long-term Vision it'll
make it easier to stay on track and more
fulfilling T is for time bound deadlines
create urgency and keep you on track use
them to your advantage part three take
action goals without actions are just
wishes here's a strategy that works
wonders break your big goal and to
smaller actionable steps psychologists
call this chunking and it's a powerful
tool to make daunting goals more
manageable take actor Will Smith's
advice he said you don't set out to
build a wall you say I'm going to lay
this brick as perfectly as a brick can
be laate you do that every single day
and soon you have a wall focus on one
small task at a time before you know it
you'll have a wall now taking action is
great but sometimes you need extra
support to keep pushing forward whether
it's dealing with the mental hurdles of
goal setting or staying motivated along
the way and that's where today's sponsor

tracking your progress now that you set
your goals and you have a good idea what
you need to do it's time to measure your
progress tracking your progress is like
having a compass for your goal Journey
it helps you stay on course make
adjustments and celebrate small wins
here's how use tools like habit trackers
apps or even a simple journal to write
down the steps you're taking towards
your goal reward yourself for the
Milestones you reach rewards reinforce
positive behavior and keep motivation
High take popular author Stephen King
for example he sets himself a goal to
write 2,000 words a day steadily
crafting his literary masterpieces one
day at a time until he's created works
like The Shining or it taking dreams to
Reality Part Five overcoming obstacles
no gold journey is free of its
challenges the things in life that are
the most worthwhile are often the
hardest the trick is to view challenges
as opportunities for growth scientist
Thomas Edison offers an inspiring
example of this in 1914 when Edison's
lab burned down destroying years of hard
work he famously said thank goodness all
our mistakes were destroyed now we can
start fresh this resilient mindset
helped them to succeed where others
might have quit when You Face setbacks
ask yourself these questions what can I
learn from this how can I adapt my plan
remember flexibility doesn't mean
abandoning your goal it means finding A
Better Way Forward time to tie this all
together at the end of the day goals
aren't just about achieving things
they're about who you become in the
process now it's your turn start by
asking yourself what's one goal that
excites you where would you like to be
in a year write it down make it smart
and take your first step today how are
you going to Define develop and adjust
your goals how are you going to deal
with any setbacks remember that the
journey of 1,000 miles begins with a
single step and don't forget progress
always beats Perfection besides that
guys stay tuned
